text: Imagine Me Gone is a 2016 novel by American author and novelist Adam Haslett. It concerns a couple, Margaret and John, who marry despite John's crippling depression, and is narrated by the couple and their three children. The novel was short-listed for the National Book Award and the 2017 Pulitzer Prize for Fiction. ==Reception== The novel received positive reviews. Critics particularly focused on the quality of Haslett's prose. Lara Feigel, writing for The Guardian called his writing "finely adapted for each of the characters". ==References== Category:2016 American novels Category:English- language novels Category:Books about depression
